bestBHT.bht: Jesus instructed his disciples to there abide in one house and not shift quarters or move around. This command emphasized the importance of stability, commitment, and building relationships within a community. By staying in one place, the disciples could fully invest themselves in the town or city they were visiting, establishing connections and relying on the hospitality of others. They were to find a home and not leave until departing from that location, making the most of the opportunity to share Jesus' message (Matthew 10:10).

John Gill: Do not shift quarters, or move from house to house.
The house you come into first, go out of last, when ye leave the town or city.
Do not leave the house, till you depart out of the town or city.
John Wesley: There abide and thence depart — That is, stay in that house till ye leave the city.

bhtAttempts.bht: When Jesus said, There abide, he was instructing his disciples to stay in one house and not move from place to place. They were to enter a town or city and find a home to stay in, not leaving until they departed from that location. This teaching emphasized the importance of stability and commitment, as well as the need to establish relationships and connections within a community. Jesus wanted his disciples to fully invest themselves in the place they were visiting, relying on the hospitality and generosity of others as they spread his message.

Jesus told his disciples to there abide, meaning they were to stay in one house and not shift quarters or move from place to place. This instruction emphasized stability, commitment, and the importance of establishing relationships within a community. They were to find a home in a town or city and not leave until departing from that location. This approach allowed the disciples to fully invest themselves in the place they were visiting, relying on the hospitality of others as they shared Jesus' message (Matthew 10:10).
